title: Chapter 5. Of Simple Ideas of Divers Senses
sourceDesc: Locke’s [Essay] was first published in December 1689, but with a publication year of 1690 on the title page. The copytext for this version is the 4th edition of 1700, which is the last edition to be printed in Locke’s lifetime, and contains several changes and additions. The text is derived from a transcription of the first edition from EEBO-TCP. Several changes are being made to this source, to bring the text in line with the 1700 edition.
author: John Locke

blocks.content: £1 CHAP. V. £1 £2 _Of simple _Ideas_ of divers Senses._ £2

THe _Ideas_ we get by more than one Sense, are of _Space,_ or _Extension, Figure, Rest,_ and _Motion:_ For these make perceivable impressions, both on the Eyes and Touch; and we can receive and convey into our Minds, the _Ideas_ of the Extension, Figure, Motion, and Rest of Bodies, both by seeing and feeling. But having occasion to speak more at large of these, in another place, I here only enumerate them.
